item.title: 中国在抑制产能过剩的同时下调主要金属增长目标
item.description: 中国已削减了 2025 年和 2026 年主要有色金属的年产量增长目标，这凸显出中国的政策已从数量扩张转向效率和可持续性。【原文：China has slashed its annual output growth target for key non-ferrous metals over 2025 and 2026, underscoring a policy shift from volume expansion to efficiency and sustainability.】

item.title: 美国加征关税，新西兰葡萄种植者迎接艰难的一年
item.description: 据行业机构称，新西兰葡萄酒业正准备迎接充满挑战的一年，因为美国的关税可能会抑制其最大市场的需求，而2025年的丰收又会增加供应。【原文：New Zealand’s wine industry is bracing for a challenging year as US tariffs threaten to curb demand in its largest market just as a strong 2025 harvest increases supply, according to the industry body.】

item.title: 印度 IT 股在经历 2 月以来最长连跌后有望走出困境
item.description: 在交易日开始之前，我们为您带来可能影响市场的重要新闻和事件摘要。今天我们关注【原文：Before the trading day starts we bring you a digest of the key news and events that are likely to move markets. Today we look at:】

item.title: 塔塔资本 IPO 募资 17 亿美元，创印度 2025 年最大上市纪录
item.description: 塔塔资本有限公司（Tata Capital Ltd. ）的首次公开募股正在寻求筹集高达 1,550 亿卢比（17 亿美元）的资金，这将是印度今年迄今为止规模最大的一次上市。【原文：Tata Capital Ltd.’s initial public offering is seeking to raise as much as 155 billion rupees ($1.7 billion), in what is set to be India’s largest listing so far this year.】

item.title: 日本电产会计丑闻扩大影响信任度，股价下滑
item.description: 日本电产公司（Nidec Corp. ）发现了更多涉嫌不当记账的情况，这加剧了人们对这家全球最大的微型电机制造商可能会受到监管审查而退市的担忧，从而导致该公司股价下滑。【原文：Nidec Corp. shares slid after the company discovered more suspected cases of improper bookkeeping, heightening fears the world’s biggest maker of mini motors may come under regulatory scrutiny for a potential delisting.】

item.title: 中国九月份液化天然气进口量连续第十一个月下降
item.description: 中国九月份的液化天然气进口量将比去年同期下降五分之一以上，在国内供应和管道天然气流量保持强劲的情况下，中国的液化天然气采购量将继续下滑。【原文：China’s imports of liquefied natural gas in September are poised to drop more than a fifth from a year ago, extending a slump in purchases as domestic supplies and piped flows remain robust.】

item.title: 中国假期前投资者转趋谨慎，铁矿石下跌
item.description: 由于中国将从周三起休市一周，在这一重大节假日之前，市场基调谨慎，铁矿石下跌。【原文：Iron ore declined due to a cautious tone ahead of a major holiday in China that’ll see mainland markets closed for a week from Wednesday.】

item.title: 债券交易员寄希望于鸽派的印度央行重振低迷市场
item.description: 最近几周，印度债券一直处于无精打采的交易状态，分析师称，只有本周印度储备银行发出强烈的鸽派信号，才可能有助于重燃看涨情绪。【原文：Indian bonds have been stuck in listless trading in recent weeks, with analysts saying only strong dovish signals from the Reserve Bank of India this week may help rekindle bullish sentiment.】

item.title: 北京削减炼油能力计划在部分地区遭遇挫折
item.description: "先建新，后废旧 "可以写在中国承诺解决工业产能过剩问题的墓碑上。【原文：“Build the new before abolishing the old” could be written on the tombstone of China’s pledge to fix its problem with industrial overcapacity.】

item.title: 日本股市下跌，除息股拖累基准股价
item.description: 日本股市周一下跌，原因是 3 月和 9 月财年结束的除息股票拖累了股价基准。【原文：Japanese shares fell on Monday as ex-dividend stocks with fiscal year endings in March and September weighed on the stock price benchmarks.】

item.title: 交易员权衡美国停摆和美联储利率，黄金接近历史最高水平
item.description: 由于交易商考虑到美国政府可能关门，这可能会推迟本周关键就业数据的公布，并可能给美联储的货币政策路径蒙上阴影，黄金走高。【原文：Gold edged higher — after notching a sixth weekly gain — as traders weighed a potential US government shutdown that could delay the release of pivotal jobs data this week and potentially cloud the Federal Reserve’s monetary policy path.】

item.title: 中国 560 亿美元债券超发揭示投资转向
item.description: 最近几周，中国各省已经突破了为调整隐性债务而设定的年度举债上限，比全年计划多筹集了约 4000 亿元人民币（560 亿美元），超额举债将导致用于投资的资金减少。【原文：Chinese provinces have in recent weeks blown past an annual cap on borrowing meant to restructure their hidden debt, raising about 400 billion yuan ($56 billion) more than planned for the entire year in an overshoot that will leave less money for investment.】

item.title: 新西兰央行称大流行性通胀为未来冲击提供了教训
item.description: 新西兰央行首席经济学家保罗-康威（Paul Conway）说，新西兰央行已经从大流行病后的快速通胀中吸取了教训，现在能够更好地应对未来的冲击。【原文：New Zealand’s central bank has learned lessons from the post-pandemic bout of fast inflation and is now better placed to respond to future shocks, chief economist Paul Conway said.】

item.title: 中国假日热潮与服务业支点或将重振消费类股票
item.description: 中国即将到来的八天黄金周假期，加上最近对服务业采取的刺激措施，预计将刺激消费，并有可能重振消费类股票的情绪。【原文：China’s upcoming eight-day Golden Week holiday, alongside recent stimulus measures for service industries, is expected to spur spending and potentially revive sentiment for consumer stocks.】

item.title: 有迹象表明欧佩克+将在 11 月再次提高产量，石油价格下跌
item.description: 由于预期欧佩克+将在 11 月份再次增产，加剧了市场对供应过剩的担忧，石油在本周初下跌。【原文：Oil declined at the start of the week as expectations that OPEC+ will hike production again in November exacerbated concerns about a glut.】

item.title: 英国公司对冷却市场中的起薪保密
item.description: 英国公司越来越不愿意透露为填补空缺职位所愿意支付的薪酬，这表明在劳动力市场疲软的情况下，雇主不再面临提高工资的压力。【原文：UK companies are becoming less forthcoming about what they’re willing to pay to fill open roles, indicating that employers are no longer under pressure to boost wages in a weakening labor market.】

item.title: 澳大利亚 2025 财年最终预算赤字将有所收窄
item.description: 由于强劲的就业增长有助于增加收入，澳大利亚 2025 财年的预算赤字将比中左翼政府约六个月前的预测有所收窄。【原文：Australia will report a narrower budget deficit for fiscal 2025 than the center-left government forecast about six months ago as strong employment gains helped bolster revenue.】

item.title: 全球资金回流，中国市场摆脱 "不可投资 "标签
item.description: 全球资金经理们在多年回避中国市场之后，又被中国股价的世界性上涨和高科技产业的进步所吸引。【原文：Global money managers are venturing back into China after years of aversion, piqued by a world-beating stock rally and the country’s advances in high-tech industries.】

item.title: 香港和印度推动了股票资本市场的蓬勃发展
item.description: 亚洲的银行家们正在为今年股权资本市场交易的最后冲刺做好准备：香港和印度。【原文：Bankers in Asia are readying for the final stretch of a standout year for deals in equity capital markets, led by two powerhouses: Hong Kong and India.】

item.title: 人工智能热潮推动中国硬件股实现三位数涨幅
item.description: 得益于人工智能计算能力需求的飙升，三家中国硬件制造商成为今年 A 股市场的宠儿。【原文：A trio of Chinese hardware makers has emerged as the darlings of the A-share market this year, thanks to soaring demand for artificial intelligence computing power.】

item.title: 欧佩克+（OPEC+）再次增产，石油价格下跌：市场综述
item.description: 在有报道称欧佩克+可能会在 11 月份再次提高石油产量之后，石油价格下跌，而美元则持稳，因为交易商在关注本周晚些时候美国政府可能关门的威胁。【原文：Oil declined following reports that OPEC+ will likely raise oil output again in November, while the dollar was steady as traders monitor the threat of a possible US government shutdown later this week.】

item.title: 索尼金融分拆后将在东京证券交易所上市
item.description: 索尼金融集团公司（Sony Financial Group Inc.【原文：Sony Financial Group Inc. shares will start trading on Tokyo bourse on Monday after being spun off from Sony Group Corp. which is moving to focus on its entertainment and image sensor businesses.】

item.title: 越南贸易商称黄金改革将帮助越南盾，抑制价格差距
item.description: 越南黄金协会表示，越南放松国家控制和改革黄金市场的计划将有助于减少货币波动，缩小国内价格与全球价格之间的巨大差距。【原文：Vietnam’s plans to loosen the state’s grip and reform the gold market will help reduce currency volatility and narrow an outsized gap between domestic and global prices, according to the nation’s gold association.】

item.title: 比亚迪将价格战引入日本，以赢得客户青睐
item.description: 在比亚迪公司高调进军日本市场两年多之后，这家中国电动汽车制造商仍在努力赢得驾驶者的青睐。【原文：More than two years after BYD Co.’s high-profile foray into the Japanese market, the Chinese electric vehicle maker is still struggling to win over drivers.】

item.title: 据说 Genmab 接近达成收购癌症药物制造商 Merus 的交易
item.description: 据知情人士透露，丹麦的 Genmab A/S 公司正在进行收购荷兰制药商 Merus NV 公司的谈判，该公司正在开发一种治疗头颈部癌症的药物。【原文：Denmark’s Genmab A/S is in advanced talks to acquire Merus NV, a Dutch drugmaker that’s developing a treatment for cancer of the head and neck, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 里夫斯试图让工党相信财政克制可以赢得选票
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）可以确信债券市场支持她。但周一她要面对的是自己的政党，她可能会发现他们更难赢得支持。【原文：Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves can be sure the bond markets have her back. But on Monday she faces down her own party, and she may find them tougher to win over.】

item.title: 新西兰 Synlait 公司同意出售 1.77 亿美元资产以减少债务
item.description: Synlait Milk 将以 3.07 亿新西兰元（1.77 亿美元）的价格向雅培实验室出售其在新西兰的几项资产，使其能够在经历了一段时间的亏损和业绩不佳之后重新调整资产负债表。【原文：Synlait Milk will sell several of its New Zealand assets to Abbott Laboratories for NZ$307 million ($177 million), enabling it to reset its balance sheet after a period of losses and underperformance.】

item.title: 比索危机将抵押贷款利率推高至 15%，颠覆了 Milei 议程
item.description: 国家银行的高管们正准备前往华尔街，开始为出售债券做宣传，以便为阿根廷国内的抵押贷款提供资金。【原文：Executives from Banco Nacion were preparing to head to Wall Street, ready to start making the pitch for a bond sale that would bankroll mortgages back home in Argentina.】

item.title: 阿尔及利亚将首次发行 23 亿美元主权债券
item.description: 阿尔及利亚打算通过首次发行主权债券筹集 2 970 亿第纳尔（23 亿美元），以帮助解决不断扩大的预算赤字问题。【原文：Algeria intends to raise 297 billion dinars ($2.3 billion) from its first-ever sovereign sukuk issuance to help address a widening budget deficit.】

item.title: 债券交易员称反弹取决于面临停摆风险的就业数据
item.description: 未来几天，债券投资者面临的最大问题是，每月公布的美国就业报告是否会动摇他们已经摇摆不定的信念，即美联储是否会在 10 月份再次降息。【原文：The big question for bond investors in the days ahead is whether the monthly US jobs report will shake their already-wavering conviction in another Federal Reserve interest-rate cut as soon as October.】
